result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Riley J Schafer

records.addlTxt:
11:55 AM Defendant Riley J Schafer in court.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for Riley J Schafer.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for State of Wisconsin. Case on for Status Conference.  Defense attorney updates the Court: resolved- offer is to plead to misdemeanor child neglect, joint rec for 1 yr probation w/conditions and eligible for expunction.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:48 AM Defendant Riley J Schafer in court.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for Riley J Schafer.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for State of Wisconsin. Case on for Status Conference.  Defense attorney updates the Court: requesting additional status.
Status conference scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Status conference on October 27, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Status conference on October 5, 2022 at 10:45 am.

9:26 AM Called 22CF107 for STC. Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Riley J Schafer in court.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for Riley J Schafer. Attny Pollak updates the court, have discovery and offer.  Large amount of discovery which has prompted addition research.  Offer plea to count as charged, no recommendation of up front confinement.  Bond continues. Status conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on September 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.

2:42 PM Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Riley J Schafer in court.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for Riley J Schafer. Case on for Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts.
Status conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on August 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.

2:31 PM Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Riley J Schafer in court.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for Riley J Schafer. Case is on for preliminary hearing.  State calls first witness, Detective Travis Thiex, who is sworn in and testifies.  State wishes to let witness review the report to refresh his recollection- Atty Pollak objects; hasn't reviewed, will review in court now.  Witness refreshes recollection with criminal complaint instead (for efficiency); refreshes recollection 3x.  Witness Witness has identified the defendant.  Venue is made.  Atty Pollak crosses.  No redirect.  Witness steps down.  No further witnesses called.  ADA Schmidt argues for bind over.  Atty Pollak argues to dismiss.  No rebuttal.  Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and the defendant probably committed it.  The matter is bound over for further proceedings.  The State files information mirroring complaint.
Arraignment scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on June 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

01:33 PM Defendant, Riley J Schafer, appeared with Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for the State.  Case on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Time limits to prelim not waived.  State does not request bond at this time.  Prior to leaving the courthouse, the defendant shall report to the sheriff's dept. to provide fingerprints.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Riley J Schafer
Current: PO Box 594, Grantsburg, WI 54840   (Effective: 05-25-2022)
Prior: 23580 County Rd Y, Grantsburg, WI 54840
